deleteConfirmation.title: Confirm Deletion

common.meritsAndQuotaDescription:
Merits are the currency of Meriter, needed to rate and comment on posts. In each community, merits are separate.
There is an exception: Marathon of Good merits can be used in Image of the Future (see game rules on the "About" page).
In this community, you have access to the following types of merits:
common.quotaExplanation: Merits you receive daily. If you don't use them by the end of the day, they expire.
common.permanentMeritsExplanation: Permanent merits you received from other community members through your posts. They don't expire, you can use them whenever you want.

home.tip1: Transfer points from publications and comments to your available balance to use them
home.tip2: Transfer your available balance to publications and comments to increase their visibility

comments.downvoteExplanation: You are voting against publication. Please leave a detailed explanation, the reason for your decision.

comments.commentHint: Tell us why you gave this rating. We value your opinion
comments.reasonRequired: A reason for your vote is required
comments.commentRequired: Comment is required for voting on a post
comments.votingMechanics:
You can vote FOR a post or AGAINST it.
For voting FOR, merits from your daily quota are spent first, and after it is exceeded, merits from your wallet.
For voting AGAINST, only wallet merits can be used.
comments.whatWillHappen: What will happen if you vote:
comments.downvoteRequiresBalance: Negative voting is only possible from Balance.
comments.downvoteViewerReason: Viewers can only vote using daily quota. Downvotes require wallet merits.
comments.withdrawToBalance: Withdraw points from publications to your Balance
comments.upvoteFromMixed: Vote using daily quota and wallet
comments.downvoteFromMixed: Vote negatively using daily quota and wallet
comments.otherUsersVotes: Other users left votes on this vote:

communities.title: Communities

communities.quotaHelper: Every day you receive merits that you can use to rate posts in this community, encouraging authors or expressing your dissatisfaction. This is called a quota, and this counter shows how many quota merits you have now.
